title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 14, 2019).

Trump directed a full withdrawal of U.S. troops from northern Syria, Defense Secretary Esper said, removing a last impediment to Turkey's expanding incursion and marking an accelerated U.S. pullback from the campaign against Islamic State.

Hundreds of foreign women and children linked to ISIS escaped from a camp in Syria when Turkish-backed fighters attacked it.

Hunter Biden is stepping down as a director at a Chinese private-equity firm and said he wouldn't serve on any foreign boards if his father is elected president.

The U.S. envoy to the EU plans to tell Congress that Trump assured him that there was no quid pro quo in the president's dealings with Ukraine.

U.S. officials and representatives of the Afghan Taliban have begun discussing ways to revive a peace process after talks fell apart last month.

A U.S. announcement Friday that it is delivering more missile-defense systems and troops to Saudi Arabia intensifies a face-off with Iran.

Talks on an agreement to ease the U.K. out of the EU were set to continue after negotiators failed to achieve a breakthrough over the weekend.

Typhoon Hagibis left at least 31 people dead and 15 missing in Japan, local media reported.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 14, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
